Create my first class

Here is an equation

{% raw %} $$\exp(-j \pi)$$ {% endraw %}

{% raw %}

class Ability[source]

Ability(damage, damage_type)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ability = Ability(100,"fire")
print(ability)

a jet of fire shot towards
{% endraw %}

Create next class

{% raw %}

class Character[source]

Character(name, max_health, ability)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
char = Character("Mr Mage", 100, ability)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Mage[source]

Mage(name, max_health, ability) :: Character

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Create next class

{% raw %}

class Demon[source]

Demon(name, max_health) :: Character

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Some testing cells

{% raw %} 
mage = Mage("Mr Mage", 100, Ability(10, "water"))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
mage.attack(mage)

From Mr Mage's wand, ice cold water is flung towards Mr Mage.
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print(mage)

        Mr Mage's Current Health: 90
        Mr Mage's Max Health: 100
        Mr Mage's Ability Damage: 10
        Mr Mage's Ability Type: water
